citation.article-title: A new anaerobic bacterium, forming up to five endospores per cell - Anaerobacter polyendosporus gen. et spec. nov.

p.s: Anaerobacter (An.ae.ro.bac'ter; Gr.pref. an- not; Gr.masc.n. aer air; M.L.masc.n. bacter the equivalent of Gr.neut.n. bacterion rod, staff; M.L.masc.n. Anaerobacter rod not [living] in air)
The cells are thick rods or have oval and sphere shape depending on growth conditions.
The oval and spherical cells are capable of forming three and more endospores.
Sensitive to antibiotics efficient against eubacteria.
Gram-positive by the type of cell wall structure.
The reserve polysaccharide is not concentrated as granules, but is distributed diffusely throughout the cytoplasm.
Does not use sulfate as electron acceptor.
Does not require vitamines or any other growth factors.
The DNA contains low percent of guanine plus cytosine.
